title: The inverse function theorem
text: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).
speech: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).
pacedSpeech: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).

title: Finding the Inverse of f(x) at $$a=0$$.
text: To find the inverse of f(x) where $$a=-8$$, then we need to first find what value of $$x$$ when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of $$-8$$. In this case, it is when $$x=\frac{1}{3}$$, so we know that $$f^{\left(-1\right)} \left(-8\right)=\frac{1}{3}$$.
speech: To find the inverse of f(x) where  a is equal to negative 8 , then we need to first find what value of  x  when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of  negative 8 . In this case, it is when  x is equal to 1 third , so we know that  the parentheses negative 1  power of, f of negative 8 is equal to 1 third .

title: Finding the derivative of f(f**(-1)(x)))
text: We found that the inverse of f(x) $$=\frac{1}{3}$$ in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what $$\operatorname{f'}\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)$$ equals, which is given to us, it is $$2$$.
speech: We found that the inverse of f(x)  is equal to 1 third  in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what , f prime, of 1 third,  equals, which is given to us, it is  2 .

title: Applying the Inverse Function Theorem
text: Since we know that $$\operatorname{f'}\left(f^{\left(-1\right)} \frac{1}{3}\right)$$ equals $$2$$, we can can apply the inverse function theorem by doing 1/(our answer). In this case this is $$\frac{1}{2}=\frac{1}{2}$$.
speech: Since we know that  f prime, of parentheses f raised to the parentheses negative 1  power 1 third   equals  2 , we can can apply the inverse function theorem by doing 1/(our answer). In this case this is  1 half is equal to 1 half .
